public void setRailsFromTo(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace from,
                                        org.bukkit.block.BlockFace to)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the rails above this sign to connect with the from and to directions
        If the cart has to be reversed, that is done

        Deprecated: no longer limited to BlockFace directions, use junctions instead
        Parameters:
        from - direction
        to - direction

public void setRailsTo(Direction direction)

        Sets the rails above this sign to lead from the minecart direction into a direction specified
        Relative directions, like left and right, are relative to the sign direction

        Deprecated: no longer limited to BlockFace directions, use junctions instead
        Parameters:
        direction - to set the rails to

      • findJunction

        public RailJunction findJunction(Direction direction)
        Attempts to find a junction of the rails block belonging to this sign event by a Direction statement. This also handles logic such as sign-relative left, right and forward.
        Parameters:
        direction -
        Returns:
        junction, null if not found

      • getPower

        public PowerState getPower(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace from)

      • isPowered

        public boolean isPowered(org.bukkit.block.BlockFace from)

      • isPowered

        public boolean isPowered()
        Gets whether this Sign is powered according to the sign rules.
        • If this is a REDSTONE_ON event, true is returned
        • If this is a REDSTONE_OFF event, false is returned
        • If the sign header indicates always-on, true is returned all the time
        • If the sign header indicates power inversion, true is returned when no Redstone power exists
        • For other cases (default), true is returned when Redstone power exists to this sign
        Returns:
        True if the sign is powered, False if not

      • isPoweredRaw

        @Deprecated
public boolean isPoweredRaw(boolean invert)
        Deprecated. 
        Checks if this sign is powered, ignoring settings on the sign.

        Deprecated: Use PowerState#isSignPowered(signBlock, inverted) instead
        Parameters:
        invert - True to invert the power as a result, False to get the normal result
        Returns:
        True if powered when not inverted, or not powered and inverted

      • isWatchedDirectionsDefined

        public boolean isWatchedDirectionsDefined()
        Gets whether the watched directions of this Sign are defined on the first line. If this returns True, user-specified watched directions are used. If this returns False, environment-specific watched directions are used.
        Returns:
        True if defined, False if not
